question:
You recently bought a piece of equipment for your kitchen but it did not 
work. You phoned the shop but no action was taken. 
Write a letter to the shop manager. In your letter 
x describe the problem with the equipment 
x explain what happened when you phoned the shop 
x say what you would like the manager to do
text: I am Utsav, who recently purchased a dining set from your store on the 18th of September, writing to express my remorse regarding the services rendered by your organisation, The Pepper Fry.

To begin with, 2 of the 4 chairs of the dining set lack proper padding. As a result, my family and I always feel uncomfortable sitting on them. Additionally, one of the chairs has burnt marks on its leg.

Upon discussing the same with the service department of your firm, I was treated condescendingly by the service manager, Mr Harish Singh, over a telephone call, who told me to deal with this hurdle on my own while neglecting my service request.

In the wake of this problem, I would like to request you to kindly provide a resolution on the same by replacing the dining set with a brand new one or providing a technician to repair the aforementioned issues. I am certain that you would investigate this problem at your earliest convenience.
I look forward to your response.
